triples.name: Logistic regression
triples.relevance: Used as one of the supervised machine learning algorithms for heart disease classification in the study.

triples.name: Decision tree learning
triples.relevance: Applied as a classification algorithm to build predictive models for heart disease prediction.

triples.name: Support vector machine
triples.relevance: Employed as a supervised learning method for heart disease classification in the comparative study.

triples.name: K-nearest neighbors algorithm
triples.relevance: Used as one of the five supervised machine learning models evaluated for disease prediction.

triples.name: Naive Bayes classifier
triples.relevance: Applied as a probabilistic classification method in the heart disease prediction models.

triples.name: Cardiovascular disease
triples.relevance: The primary medical task being addressed through machine learning prediction in this study.

triples.name: List of datasets for machine-learning research
triples.relevance: References the UCI dataset repository from which the 1025-sample heart disease dataset was obtained.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The fundamental field and methodology applied to develop and test disease prediction algorithms.

triples.name: Statistical classification
triples.relevance: The core statistical approach used for classifying patients into disease/non-disease categories.

triples.name: Supervised learning
triples.relevance: The machine learning paradigm used to train all five classification algorithms with labeled training data.
